definitions: Called upon (a deity or spirit) in prayer, as a witness, or for inspiration.
Appealed to (someone or something) as an authority for an action or in support of an argument.
Cited or appealed to (a law, right, or principle) in support of one's actions or argument.
examples: The ancient ritual invoked the spirits of the ancestors.
He invoked his Fifth Amendment rights.
The lawyer invoked a previous ruling to support her case.
The spell invoked a powerful magical entity.
